urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Ministers must account for how Tory-linked firms were handed billions of pounds of public money in COVID contracts.

I have secured a debate next Wednesday (9th December) following the National Audit Office's investigation into government procurement during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/3lBiXCNArp

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text:
I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

Have a look at our latest news bulletin about #HebdenBridgeFAS outlining early works taking place to prepare for the flood defences.

It includes ground investigation work at White Lion carpark pictured. Check out our interactive map for details 
https://t.co/Y2tdmiVOaF https://t.co/YabD7GEHi5
@AndyWoodturner @RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Absolutely correct the perpetrators will have worked out likely fine probably taken barristers advice.
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Recklessness like this makes the whole Environmental Personhood debate more relevant. If the Lugg was legally a person, would this have happened?

Terrible to hear about this eco-vandalism at #RiverLuggSSSI in #Herefordshire

It's a clear breach of environmental legislation, and test case for @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency enforcement

We @WildlifeTrusts will be following it very carefully https://t.co/YZpRTggpl4

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category

tweets.text: @MarkAvery @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WCL_News @GreenAllianceUK @Natures_Voice @WildlifeTrusts @Buzz_dont_tweet @Love_plants @Feargal_Sharkey Thank you for highlighting this case. @NHDCLibDems are fighting to rescue our chalkstreams incl the Ivel - Affinity know they can't keep sucking the life out of our rivers. Time to invest in reservoirs?https://t.co/Fn5KyC97UH

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency This is a job for @NaturalEngland who are the regulator for SSSIs - although sadly understandable why many wouldn't know that... https://t.co/PqrO4Kja1D

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text: Same view a few weeks apart on the River Lugg. This is surely one one the most wanton acts of destruction we've seen in years. https://t.co/mI9zobAkU7 @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot https://t.co/b9K7li4Tvc

@TheMontyDon Apart from raising awareness on here, any suggestions how to stop it happening again elsewhere.  Can we all write to our mp or the mininster in charge of the countryside?  Action needs taken

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
This is just a few miles from Longmeadow. It breaks my heart but is all too-typical of the ignorance, arrogance and sheer wanton destruction of those privileged to care for our countryside.

Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river  https://t.co/6uTt85hYaF

urls.title: Beavers build first Exmoor dam in 400 years
urls.description: The National Trust says the dam in Somerset "might look modest, but it is incredibly special".

tweets.text:
The first beaver dam in over 400 years appeared on Exmoor after beavers were released into the wild in January.

These rodents can play an important role in engineering the landscape and helping to restore streams and reduce #flooding.

Learn more: https://t.co/h7VascPfWg
@grahamhrtn @CraigBennett3 @SteveCJjones @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts It is

Hell of a river story here - the very opposite of the work being done up here by @EdenRiversTrust @leeinthelakes @UllswaterCic @herdyshepherd1 & more...

@AmyJaneBeer @simonbarneswild @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/ydhNNXtIk6

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

tweets.text: @CraigBennett3 @SteveCJjones @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts Is that really the same view? River looks like it bends to the left in the image on the left?

@grahamhrtn @CraigBennett3 @SteveCJjones @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts @timthefruit has posted other pictures on his timeline, the damage appears to stretch further and is worse than the photos above show

@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Any potential fine was no doubt factored into the plan...they'll pay, if charged, eventually, wait a few years, and initiate whatever plan they had. Fines and complete restoration at their cost is the only real punishment for such wilful destruction.

Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

@DJ_Renney @inthesticks @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot Need to be careful not to prejudice any prosecutions by naming anyone prematurely. The statutory agencies are on the case - I hope. @NaturalEngland have issued a stop order. Not sure yet what @ForestryComm @EnvAgency or @HfdsCouncil have done. @HerefordshireWT are pressuring hard

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
The River Lugg, in Herefordshire, one of the most beautiful and important rivers in the UK, has been intentionally destroyed over a stretch of approximately 1.5km with huge repercussions for wildlife downstream üëá 

https://t.co/NKDHJhVn3s
